Comment: BSRN station. Only initial calibration constants were given (2014). All data is missing for 2017 and 2018. Overall very little data - consider not using station at all!

Name: Da Nang
Comment: data quality good in 2017 and 2019. in 2018 data quality ok with many small data gaps

Name: Dar Es Salaam
Comment: 2015: Medium quality of data. Data gap between mid September and December and in May and June 2015. 2016 and 2017: medium quality of data

Name: Florianopolis
Comment: BSRN station. Only initial calibration constants were given (2012). Periods during 2018 removed due to suspecion of tilted sensor (see in DNI_meas-DNI_calc plot).

Name: USAid Univ. of Fort Hare (Alice, South Africa)
geraldton_airport (Australia)
Comment: Excellent coherence between solar components. Difference between measured and calculated DNI < 0.1 W/m2  almost always

Name: Goodwin Creek
Comment: Excellent coherence between solar components. Difference between measured and calculated DNI < 0.1 W/m2  almost always

Name: Islamabad
Comment: excluded March to Mid June 2015 due to severe Tracker issues

Name: University of Jordan
Comment: 2016: Last calibration of all irradiance sensors in November 2014. 2017: Installation of freshly calibrated irradiance sensors in Jan 2017. Sensor maintenance/cleaning poor throughout the year.. 2018: Most of the data missing due to broken tracker. Year sorted out. 2019: Installation of freshly calibrated pyrheliometer in March 2019 and BSRN calibration of pyranometers. Tracker broken during most of the year. Year sorted out.

Name: Kasama
Comment: dew in the morning in winter. Flagged manually

Name: kalgoorlie_boulder_airport (Australia)
Comment: Excellent coherence between solar components. Difference between measured and calculated DNI < 0.5 W/m2  almost always

Name: Kaoma
Comment: dew in the morning in winter. Flagged manually

Name: Kiruna
Comment: excluded February 2017 to May 2017 from Benchmark because of suspected sensor tilt

Name: Lauder
Comment: Removed a suspicious period (oct - dec 2018) with a sudden increase in clearness sky index

Name: learmonth_airport (Australia)
Comment: Excellent coherence between solar components. Clear sky index constant

Name: Lusaka
Comment: dew in the morning in winter. Flagged manually

Name: melbourne_airport (Australia)
Comment: Slight assymetry in GHI AM/PM at high SZA

Name: Missour Morocco, IRESEN
Comment: 2015: Last calibration of all irradiance sensors in June 2013. 2016: Installation of freshly calibrated irradiance sensors in March 2016. 2018: Tracker off most of the time after Mid-March 2018. Data quality low the rest of the year. 2019:  Tracker off until October 2019. Installation of freshly calibrated pyrheliometer in July 2019 and DHI pyranometer in October 2019. Data quality from October to December 2019 ok. 2020: Only GHI pyranometer calibration out of date. Many small data gaps throughout the whole period. Data quality bad.

Name: Mutanda
Comment: dew in the morning in winter. Flagged manually

Name: Neumayer Station
Comment: Excellent coherence between solar components. Difference between measured and calculated DNI < 0.75 W/m2  (but with a slight right-sided distribution). Excellent assymetry in GHI AM/PM plot

Name: University of Oujda
Comment: 2015: Last pyranometer calibration in June 2013. 2016: All irradiance sensors exchanged in April 2016. After exchange pyranometers might be a little inclined. Data quality ok. 2017: Pyranometers might be a little inclined.. 2018: Calibration of irradiance sensors longer than 3 years ago after April 2018. Pyranometers might be a little inclined. 2019: Pyrheliometer exchanged with freshly calibrated one in July 2019

Name: University of Texas Panamerican Solar Radiation Lab (UTPA)
Petrolina
Comment: BSRN station. Only initial calibration constants were given (2014). Overall poor quality. All years have large scatter in GHIcalc vs GHImeas plot - reason could not be identified.

Name: Nelson Mandela Univ. (Port Elizabeth, South Africa)
Rock Springs
Comment: Slight assymetry in GHI AM/PM at high SZA

Name: Sao Martinho da Serra
Comment: BSRN station. Only initial calibration constants were given. From 2017 and onwards the data is useless.

Name: Shagaya (Kuwait)
Comment: 2015: Data quality very good. But many data gaps. Maybe already QCed before. 2016: Data quality good. But many data gaps. Data available after April 2016. Maybe already QCed before. 2017: Data quality good. But many data gaps. Maybe already QCed before.

Name: Silver Lake
Comment: RSP shadow band radiometer. Clear horizon view.

Name: Plataforma Solar
Comment: 2015: Exchange of DHI pyranometer in Jan 2015

Name: Tan-Tan, Morocco IRESEN
Comment: 2015: Last calibration of all irradiance sensors in 2013 Many data gaps due to tracker failure

Name: Tataouin, Tunisia CRTEn
Comment: 2015: All irradiance sensors freshly calibrated in April 2015. 2017: Data quality ok

Name: Tiksi
Comment: Excellent coherence between solar radiation components (differences between measurred and calculated DNI is < 0.3 W/m2). Excellent GHI AM/PM symmetry

Name: townsville (Australia)
Comment: Excellent coherence between solar components. Difference between measured and calculated DNI < 0.4 W/m2  almost always
